line_1: Where Heav'n's pure rays the sacred spot illume,
line_2: But if no more the bow'rs of Fancy bloom,

line_1: With Beauty's torch the solemn scenes illume;
line_2: Breathe on each cheek young Passion's tender bloom!

line_1: No genial ray the groves illume,

O, far diffuse its op'ning bloom,

line_1: — Descending flames the dusky shrine illume;
line_2: Fire the wet wood, the sacred bull consume;

line_1: Which the swart Indian's groves illume,
line_2: Or the soft peach's stain assume.

line_1: When Summer suns these northern seas illume,
line_2: And when drear Winter spreads his cheerless gloom,
